segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 2. Rathakāravagga
segments.en: 2. The Chariot-maker

segments.pli: 20. Dutiyapāpaṇikasutta
segments.en: 20. A Shopkeeper (2nd)

segments.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti bhogesu.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a shopkeeper who has three factors soon acquires great and abundant wealth.

segments.pli: Katamehi tīhi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko cakkhumā ca hoti vidhuro ca nissayasampanno ca.
segments.en: It’s when a shopkeeper sees clearly, is responsible, and has supporters.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko cakkhumā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a shopkeeper see clearly?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko paṇiyaṃ jānāti:
segments.en: It’s when a shopkeeper knows of a product:

segments.pli: ‘idaṃ paṇiyaṃ evaṃ kītaṃ, evaṃ vikkayamānaṃ, ettakaṃ mūlaṃ bhavissati, ettako udayo’ti.
segments.en: ‘This product is bought at this price and is selling at this price. With this much investment, it’ll bring this much profit.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko cakkhumā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a shopkeeper sees clearly.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko vidhuro hoti?
segments.en: And how is a shopkeeper responsible?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko kusalo hoti paṇiyaṃ ketuñca vikketuñca.
segments.en: It’s when a shopkeeper is a skilled in buying and selling products.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko vidhuro hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a shopkeeper is responsible.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko nissayasampanno hoti?
segments.en: And how does a shopkeeper have supporters?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇikaṃ ye te gahapatī vā gahapatiputtā vā aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā te evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: It’s when rich, affluent, and wealthy householders or householders’ children know of him:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ pāpaṇiko cakkhumā vidhuro ca paṭibalo puttadārañca posetuṃ, amhākañca kālena kālaṃ anuppadātun’ti.
segments.en: ‘This good shopkeeper keeps an eye out and is responsible. They are capable of providing for their wives and children, and paying us back from time to time.’

segments.pli: Te naṃ bhogehi nipatanti:
segments.en: They deposit money with the shopkeeper, saying:

segments.pli: ‘ito, samma pāpaṇika, bhoge karitvā puttadārañca posehi, amhākañca kālena kālaṃ anuppadehī’ti.
segments.en: ‘With this, friend shopkeeper, earn money to raise your wives and children, and pay us back from time to time.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko nissayasampanno hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a shopkeeper has supporters.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti bhogesu.
segments.en: A shopkeeper who has these three factors soon acquires great and abundant wealth.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti kusalesu dhammesu.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant who has three factors soon acquires great and abundant skillful qualities.

segments.pli: Katamehi tīhi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhumā ca hoti vidhuro ca nissayasampanno ca.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant sees clearly, is responsible, and has supporters.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhumā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant see clearly?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhumā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant sees clearly.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vidhuro hoti?
segments.en: And how is a mendicant responsible?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They are strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vidhuro hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is responsible.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu nissayasampanno hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant have supporters?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā te kālena kālaṃ upasaṅkamitvā paripucchati paripañhati:
segments.en: It’s when from time to time a mendicant goes up to those mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—and asks them questions:

segments.pli: ‘idaṃ, bhante, kathaṃ, imassa ko attho’ti?
segments.en: ‘Why, sir, does it say this? What does that mean?’

segments.pli: Tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañceva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañca uttānīkaronti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti.
segments.en: Those venerables clarify what is unclear, reveal what is obscure, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu nissayasampanno hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant has supporters.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant who has these three factors soon acquires great and abundant skillful qualities.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Rathakāravaggo dutiyo.
Paṭhamabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito.
segments.en: The first recitation section is finished.

segments.pli: Ñāto sāraṇīyo bhikkhu,
cakkavattī sacetano;
Apaṇṇakattā devo ca,
duve pāpaṇikena cāti.

suttaplex.blurb: Shopkeepers and mendicants both have to be clever, responsible, and well supported.
